column3: Travis failure for `p2p-leaktests.py` unrelated :-)  Is it just me or has the number of spurious Travis failures increased recently?

> Is it just me or has the number of spurious Travis failures increased recently?\n\n@practicalswift - yes, that's my sense as well. This particular failure is a new test added by me in #11001, but I haven't seen it fail in this way before. It appears that the node doesn't receive a version message that the test framework sends to it, possibly because we're trying to connect too soon after chang
ACK after squashing. Please use a commit message that mentions updating the release notes.
